title: Ticket #3075: Proper build fails on Centos 5
description:
On Centos 5, a proper build fails because of boost.

On Centos 5, v1.33 of boost is packaged, and that version of boost does not have the boost system library, nor does it have unordered_map.hpp.

/externals/bundles/boost/1.49.0/CMakeLists.txt needs some love.

So the line 

    find_package( Boost 1.33.1 COMPONENTS thread program_options system regex filesystem)

should probably be changed to not require the COMPONENTS, since all we really need is a couple header files. Plus the "system" component does not exist in boost v1.33.

Next the code should fall back on using tr1 unordered_map if not found in boost, since although boost on centos 5 does not have unordered_map, at least the following file does exist on centos 5: 

   usr/include/c++/4.1.1/tr1/unordered_map
remarks:
2012-Jun-21 16:46:15 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW 1

So [32450] fixes the problem for proper builds, however, it now appears the patch breaks non-proper (UW style) builds. UW builds break when the configure for cream fails to build a simple classad binary. The choice of tr1 vs boost needs to be enforced in the installed classad headers without depending on the user setting a #define. See 733f6b50 for an example of how you can fix this.

2012-Jun-22 15:34:45 by tstclair:
It should be totally hidden now.

2012-Jun-27 15:21:00 by tstclair:
I believe this is all resolved now.

2012-Jul-16 17:28:52 by jfrey:
CODE REVIEW

The current setup for selecting STL unordered_map, weak_ptr, and shared_ptr look good.
